result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Terrorist Threats - Public Panic or Fear

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Branden Tremaine Raymond in court.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Branden Tremaine Raymond.  Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Court set final pretrial and jury trial dates upon request from the defense.  Defense awaiting additional discovery from the State.  Court ordered all discovery to be turned over by 11-09-2022.  Court ordered all substantive motions to be filed by 12-07-2022 and all responses to be filed by 01-04-2023 or they will be deemed waived.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for February 13, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 14 pages) commencing 07-15-2022 by Sandra M. Kandziora.

Defendant Branden Tremaine Raymond appeared by video.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg appeared by video for Branden Tremaine Raymond.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Branden Tremaine Raymond in court with Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg; both appear in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  MPD Detective Narlock. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Branden Tremaine Raymond in court, appear in person with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg, appear in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Caset set for a preliminary hearing. Due to court congestion, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Branden Tremaine Raymond in court with attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant Branden Tremaine Raymond in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
